body: Like any sane person, Joyce Kreitman pulled out a bag of jelly beans to choose a new color for her bungalow in the stately Brooklyn neighborhood of Ditmas Park. ''My mother and I sat at the kitchen table!'' recalled Ms. Kreitman, a longtime resident who tends to speak in exclamation points. ''I picked up the yellow one. I'm good with colors!'' The
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: DITMAS PARK; She Knows What She Likes, and It's Purple

body: To the Editor: In your article on school choice, ''Pick One'' (April 28), you focused on largely English-speaking, white, upper-middle-class neighborhoods, Cobble Hill and Boerum Hill, Brooklyn. We live in a more economically and ethnically diverse neighborhood, Ditmas Park, and faced the choice of public or private for our son. Many home-buyers
title: Public, Private: What's a Parent to Do?
